intro: Cynoglossum arundanum, commonly known as the heartworts, is a flowering plant belonging to the Boraginaceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces striking blue or violet flowers in summer. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in grassy areas and along roadsides. It is a perennial herb that thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. Its common name refers to the heart-shaped leaves, which are a distinctive feature of the species.
